Pre-Game Insights: Cleveland Cavaliers come into the matchup with Brooklyn Nets as winners of 10 straight games.
Cleveland Cavaliers are first in the Eastern Conference with a 10-0 record.
Brooklyn Nets are sixth in the Eastern Conference with a 4-5 record.
The Cavaliers are favored by 13 points according to BETMGM Sportsbook.
The over/under for the game is set at 224.5 points.
Cleveland finished 48-34 overall and 31-21 in Eastern Conference play last season.
Brooklyn finished 32-50 overall and 24-28 in Eastern Conference action during the 2023-24 season.
Cleveland Cavaliers averaged 7.4 steals, 4.6 blocks, and 12.7 turnovers per game last season.
Brooklyn Nets allowed opponents to score 113.3 points per game and shoot 47.0% from the field last season.
Others: Cavaliers' Emoni Bates is out with a knee injury.
Cavaliers' Max Strus is out with an ankle injury.
Nets' Bojan Bogdanovic is out with a foot injury.
Nets' Day'Ron Sharpe is out with a hamstring injury.
Nets' Trendon Watford is out with a hamstring injury.
